Name: Payments to the NYC Board of Elections.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to payments to the New York City Board of Elections

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: February 15, 2017 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files

Summary: This bill would require the New York City Board of Elections to accept credit cards as payment for fees and charges, and to have change available for cash transactions.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
	Section 1. Chapter 46 of the New York city charter is amended to add a new section 1057-f, to read as follows:
      � 1057-f Payments to the board of elections. a. The board of elections in the city of New York shall accept credit cards, pursuant to the requirements of section 5 of the general municipal law, for the payment of charges and fees incurred for services rendered by the board.
      b. The headquarters of the board of elections in the city of New York, as well as each branch office, shall provide change to persons who pay a charge or fee in cash to the board.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after becoming law.
